item.title: 美国11月核心资本货物订单超出预期
item.description: 美国关键资本货物新订单在11月增幅超出预期，表明企业设备支出在第四季度保持了稳定增长态势。【原文：New orders for key U.S.-manufactured capital goods increased more than expected ​in November, suggesting business spending on equipment ‌maintained a steady growth pace in the fourth quarter.】

item.title: 彭博社报道称，威兹航空寻求进入美国市场
item.description: 据彭博社周一报道，廉价航空公司威兹航空已申请飞往美国的许可，此前数月该公司关闭了阿布扎比基地并缩减了中东扩张计划。【原文：Budget carrier Wizz Air has applied for permission to fly to the United States, months after it closed its Abu Dhabi base and scaled back Middle East expansion plans, Bloomberg News reported on Monday.】

item.title: IonQ将以18亿美元收购SkyWater以扩展硬件能力
item.description: 量子计算公司IonQ周一宣布，将以约18亿美元收购芯片制造商SkyWater Technology。此项交易将使该公司实现半导体制造内部化，并加速其新一代量子处理器的研发进程。【原文：Quantum computing firm IonQ said on Monday it would buy chipmaker SkyWater Technology for about $1.8 billion, in a deal that would bring semiconductor manufacturing in-house and boost the development of its next-generation quantum processors.】

item.title: 英伟达向CoreWeave投资20亿美元，深化合作关系
item.description: 英伟达以每股87.20美元的价格向CoreWeave投资20亿美元，两家公司周一宣布，并表示已扩大合作以推动CoreWeave的数据中心建设计划。【原文：Nvidia has ​invested $2 billion ‌in CoreWeave at a ‌purchase price of $87.20 ​per share, the ‍companies said on Monday, ⁠adding ‍that they have ‌expanded ‌their partnership to boost ⁠CoreWeave's ⁠data ​center build out ambitions.】

item.title: 鲍勃折扣家具公司美国IPO估值最高达24.8亿美元
item.description: 由私募股权公司贝恩资本支持的鲍勃折扣家具公司周一表示，其在美国首次公开募股（IPO）中目标估值高达24.8亿美元，此举将检验投资者对消费类公司的投资热情。【原文：Bob's Discount Furniture, backed by private equity firm Bain Capital, said on Monday it ​was targeting a valuation of up to $2.48 billion in its ‌U.S. initial public offering, setting the stage to test investor appetite for consumer-focused companies.】

item.title: 詹妮弗·加纳创投公司Once Upon a Farm计划在美国IPO中寻求7.64亿美元估值
item.description: 由演员詹妮弗·加纳联合创立的儿童有机食品公司"Once Upon a Farm"周一宣布，其在美国首次公开募股（IPO）中目标估值高达7.644亿美元。随着市场对2026年消费类企业IPO将重振的乐观情绪升温，该公司正积极推进上市计划。【原文：Once Upon a Farm, the children’s organic food company co-founded by actor Jennifer Garner, said ​on Monday it was targeting a valuation of up to $764.4 ‌million in its U.S. initial public offering, as optimism grows that consumer-related IPOs will rebound in 2026.】

item.title: 晨间竞价：镀金的恐惧
item.description: 当今美国及全球市场中真正重要的因素【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 美国股指期货走低，因Mag 7结果及美联储成为焦点
item.description: 美国股市期货周一走低，投资者正为即将公布的重磅财报和美联储利率决议做准备。【原文：U.S. stock index futures slipped on Monday, as ​investors braced for a heavyweight slate of earnings reports and a Federal Reserve rate decision.】

item.title: AerCap首席执行官警告勿对地缘政治动荡反应过度
item.description: 全球最大飞机租赁公司爱尔卡普（AerCap）的负责人周一警告称，不应对近期地缘政治和经济不确定性过度反应，并表示航空融资行业遵循稳健的长期周期运作。【原文：The head of the world's largest aircraft leasing company, AerCap , cautioned on Monday against overreacting to recent geopolitical and economic uncertainty and said the aviation financing industry worked on secure long-term cycles.】

item.title: 消息人士称，随着油价攀升，欧佩克+可能维持3月暂停增产的决定
item.description: 三位欧佩克+代表向路透社透露，该组织预计将在周日的会议上维持暂停增产的决定，哈萨克斯坦原油产量下滑推动油价上涨。【原文：OPEC+ is expected to keep its pause on oil output increases for March at a meeting on Sunday, three OPEC+ delegates told Reuters, with prices rising due to a drop in Kazakhstan's oil production.】

item.title: 马斯克的自动驾驶雄心对特斯拉业绩至关重要
item.description: 特斯拉投资者周三将关注财报，期待看到埃隆·马斯克长期承诺的自动驾驶计划开始落地，尽管财报显示该公司电动汽车业务正面临日益严峻的压力。【原文：Tesla investors head into earnings on Wednesday looking for evidence that Elon Musk's long-promised self-driving bet is beginning to materialize even as results show growing strain on the company's electric-vehicle business.】

item.title: 利多斯公司以24亿美元收购恩特拉斯，以增强其公用事业工程服务能力
item.description: 利多斯控股公司周一宣布，将以约24亿美元从私募股权公司科尔伯格手中收购电力设计公司ENTRUST解决方案集团，此举旨在为公用事业客户拓展工程服务业务。【原文：Leidos Holdings said on Monday it would buy power design firm ENTRUST Solutions Group from private equity firm Kohlberg for about $2.4 billion, as it looks to expand engineering offerings for utility customers.】

item.title: 波音737增产计划或将掩盖预期中的第四季度亏损
item.description: 波音公司计划增加客机产量，并预计未来几年自由现金流将有所改善，这些将成为该飞机制造商周二公布第四季度财报时分析师和投资者关注的焦点。尽管该公司预计将再次出现季度亏损，但投资者正期待其从多年危机中持续复苏。【原文：Boeing's plans to increase jetliner production and its outlook for improving free cash flow in the coming years will be key topics for analysts and investors when the planemaker reports fourth-quarter earnings on Tuesday. While the company is expected to report another quarterly loss, investors are looking for continued recovery from years of crises.】

item.title: 中国紫金矿业将以约40亿美元收购加拿大矿业公司联合黄金
item.description: 紫金矿业周一宣布将以约55亿加元（40.2亿美元）现金收购加拿大Allied Gold公司。在黄金价格创历史新高之际，这家中国矿企正加速推进全球扩张。【原文：Zijin Gold will buy Canada's Allied Gold for about C$5.5 billion ($4.02 billion) ​in cash, the companies said on Monday, as ‌the Chinese miner ramps up its global expansion against the backdrop of record high prices of the yellow metal.】

item.title: 美国石油之都休斯顿热闹非凡，行业正为委内瑞拉石油热潮蓄势待发
item.description: 在休斯顿市中心的一家酒吧里，佩洛鲁斯码头公司的董事马修·戈伊蒂亚阐述了他最初的构想：翻新并建造海运码头，用于在委内瑞拉混合和出口原油，同时运输化工产品。【原文：In a downtown Houston bar, Matthew Goitia, a director at Pelorus Terminals, lays out his early idea to refurbish and build marine terminals that can blend and export crude and ship chemical products in Venezuela.】

item.title: 关税阴云笼罩企业盈利，即便企业已逐渐适应
item.description: 许多美国企业试图向投资者保证关税是"可控的"，但财报季初期的评论表明，随着消费者对价格上涨的抵触情绪加剧，利润率正面临风险。【原文：Many U.S. companies have sought to reassure investors that tariffs are "manageable," but early earnings-season comments suggest profit margins are at risk with consumers balking at higher prices.】

item.title: 加拿大央行周三将维持利率不变，未来货币政策取决于美加贸易谈判进展
item.description: 加拿大央行普遍预计将于周三维持政策利率在2.25%不变，但由于经济前景存在不确定性，经济学家和货币市场对加拿大今年剩余时间的货币政策走向存在分歧。【原文：The Bank of Canada is widely expected to keep its policy interest rate ​on hold at 2.25% on Wednesday but economists and money markets are divided over where Canada's monetary policy cycle ‌is headed for the rest of the year due to economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 美联储会议恐因央行独立性受威胁而蒙上阴影
item.description: 美联储本周会议预计将维持利率不变，但会议氛围受到多重因素影响：特朗普政府正对美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔展开刑事调查，美联储理事丽莎·库克面临解职动议，且鲍威尔的继任者提名程序将于五月启动。【原文：The Federal Reserve is expected to hold interest rates steady this week at a meeting overshadowed by a Trump administration criminal investigation of U.S. central bank chief Jerome Powell, an evolving effort to fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook, and the coming nomination of a successor to take over for Powell in May.】

item.title: Meta、TikTok和YouTube将因青少年成瘾指控接受法庭审判
item.description: Meta Platforms、TikTok和YouTube本周将面临法庭审查，因其平台被指助长青少年心理健康危机，而关于儿童屏幕使用时间的全国性辩论正进入新阶段。【原文：Meta Platforms, TikTok and YouTube will face courtroom scrutiny this week over allegations that their platforms are fueling a youth mental health crisis, as the national debate about kids’ screen time enters a new phase.】

item.title: 焦点：制药企业转向人工智能以加速临床试验和监管申报
item.description: 行业高管表示，人工智能尚未解决药物研发中最具挑战性的环节——发现能带来重大医学突破的新分子——但它已开始优化研发过程中那些不那么引人注目的环节。【原文：Artificial intelligence has yet to deliver on the most challenging aspect of drug development -- finding new molecules that lead to major medical advances -- but it is already streamlining less glamorous parts of the process, industry executives say.】

item.title: 独家：加拿大驻印度大使称，随着加拿大贸易战略重心转向，卡尼很可能于三月初访问印度
item.description: 加拿大总理马克·卡尼可能于3月第一周访问印度，并签署涉及铀矿、能源、矿产及人工智能领域的协议。印度驻加拿大高级专员迪内什·帕特奈克在接受采访时透露了这一消息。【原文：Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney will likely visit India the first week of March and sign deals on uranium, energy, minerals ​and artificial intelligence, Dinesh Patnaik, India's High Commissioner to Canada said in an interview.】

item.title: 金矿股价飙升，因金价创下每盎司5100美元的历史新高
item.description: 黄金矿业股周一盘前交易中大幅上涨，因金价飙升至每盎司5100美元的历史新高，延续了由地缘政治不确定性和市场波动引发的避险需求推动的历史性涨势。【原文：Shares of gold miners jumped in premarket trading on Monday, as bullion prices surged to a ​record high of $5,100 an ounce, extending a historic ‌rally driven by safe-haven demand amid geopolitical uncertainties and market volatility.】

item.title: 冬季风暴导致美国交通瘫痪，致使大量航班取消
item.description: 截至周一早间，已有超过3600个航班被取消，714个航班延误，此前周日报告的航班取消量已超过11000个。【原文：Over 3,600 flights were canceled and 714 were delayed as of early Monday, following more than 11,000 cancellations reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 韩国现代制铁计划为美国钢铁厂增资29亿美元
item.description: 韩国现代制铁周一在监管文件中表示，其关联企业现代浦项路易斯安那有限责任公司计划增资29亿美元，用于美国钢铁厂的设施投资。【原文：South ​Korea's Hyundai Steel said in a ‌regulatory filing on Monday its affiliate Hyundai-POSCO Louisiana LLC plans a capital increase worth $2.9 billion for facilities investment in a US steel ‌plant.】

item.title: 欧盟就Grok平台性化图像问题对X平台展开调查，议员称
item.description: 欧洲议会爱尔兰籍议员雷吉娜·多尔蒂周一发表声明称，欧盟委员会已就埃隆·马斯克旗下人工智能聊天机器人Grok生成露骨图像一事展开调查。【原文：The European Commission has launched an investigation into Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok over the production of explicit imagery, Regina Doherty, a member of the European parliament representing Ireland, said in a statement on Monday.】

item.title: 日本央行货币市场数据显示，日本周五未干预外汇市场
item.description: 日本银行周一公布的货币市场数据显示，上周五日元兑美元汇率的飙升很可能并非日本官方干预的结果。【原文：Bank of Japan money market data on Monday indicated that a spike in the yen rate against the dollar on Friday was not likely the product of official Japanese intervention.】

item.title: 黄金因避险需求飙升至5100美元历史新高
item.description: 周一，金价延续创纪录涨势，飙升至5100美元上方。各国央行和投资者纷纷寻求避险，以规避地缘政治风险以及特朗普引发的市场波动。【原文：Gold prices extended their record-setting rally to ​surge past $5,100 on Monday as central banks and investors sought refuge from geopolitical risks and Trump-induced ‌market volatility.】

item.title: 《商报》报道：欧盟委员会将于周一对Grok公司启动诉讼程序
item.description: 据德国《商报》周一援引三名欧盟高级官员的消息报道，欧盟委员会将于本周一依据《数字服务法》对埃隆·马斯克的人工智能聊天机器人Grok启动调查程序。【原文：The EU Commission will open proceedings against Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok under the Digital Services Act on Monday, Germany's Handelsblatt reported on Monday, citing three high-ranking EU officials.】

item.title: 美国利率检查掩盖了协调干预日元的巨大障碍
item.description: 纽约联储此次不同寻常的利率检查，引发了持续疲软的日元汇率突然飙升，这降低了干预的门槛，但美日两国协调抛售美元的行动在现阶段仍极不可能发生。【原文：The unusual rate check by the New York Federal Reserve that triggered a spike in the stubbornly weak yen has lowered the threshold for intervention, but coordinated Japan-U.S. selling of dollars still looks highly unlikely at this stage.】

item.title: 日本央行认为日元疲软对通胀的提振作用正在增强
item.description: 日本央行周一表示，日元疲软对日本通胀的影响日益加剧，因企业正积极将成本上涨转嫁给消费者。此举表明央行正密切关注不断加剧的价格压力，这可能需要进一步加息。【原文：A weak yen has an increasing impact on Japan's inflation as firms actively pass on rising costs, the central bank said on Monday, signalling its vigilance over mounting price pressures that may warrant more rises in interest rates.】
